title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\NodeTemplate
name: NodeTemplate
description:
Represent a sole-tenant Node Template resource. You can use a template to define properties for nodes in a node group. For more information, read Creating node groups and instances.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.NodeTemplate

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.cpu_overcommit_type
params.description: CPU overcommit. Check the CpuOvercommitType enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] The type of the resource. Always compute#nodeTemplate for node templates.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the resource, provided by the client when initially creating the resource. The resource name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.node_affinity_labels
params.description: Labels to use for node affinity, which will be used in instance scheduling.

params.name: data.node_type
params.description: The node type to use for nodes group that are created from this template.

params.name: data.node_type_flexibility
params.description: The flexible properties of the desired node type. Node groups that use this node template will create nodes of a type that matches these properties. This field is mutually exclusive with the node_type property; you can only define one or the other, but not both.

params.name: data.region
params.description: [Output Only] The name of the region where the node template resides, such as us-central1.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

params.name: data.server_binding
params.description: Sets the binding properties for the physical server. Valid values include: - [Default] RESTART_NODE_ON_ANY_SERVER: Restarts VMs on any available physical server - RESTART_NODE_ON_MINIMAL_SERVER: Restarts VMs on the same physical server whenever possible See Sole-tenant node options for more information.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output Only] The status of the node template. One of the following values: CREATING, READY, and DELETING. Check the Status enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.status_message
params.description: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable explanation of the status.
